comment: "Writing for The Intercept was a dream. The editor was responsive and fantastic, the pay was great, and I was beyond pleased with the final piece."
relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

comment: "The editor completely rewrote my piece. I don't mean edited, I mean wrote an entirely different piece--so different my byline felt like plagiarism. There were two sentences left that I wrote. He had good reason (it was a heavy news week so between submission and publication, part grew outdated), but it's disheartening as a writer to spend 7 hours crafting something you're highly proud of just to have it annihilated. Plus, ethically it just makes me feel smarmy to have my name on something I didn't write. That said, the editor was highly professional. I would write for them again, but preferably for a different editor or with much less time invested in the piece."
